page.title: 03THE VILLAGE CHURCH _ TODAY
page.content: {Belbroughton} church is today a place for prayer and is used by the people in the village for Sunday services, marriages, baptisms and funerals and occasionally by visiting choral societies who come to give a recital. There is a bell tower with a clock erected in celebration of Queen Victoria's Diamond Jubilee. There are six bells which are still rung regularly and a large organ which was rebuilt in 1955. The church stands in a large churchyard with many beautiful trees and the main approach to the church is through a lyche gate.
